title: Ex-QB Sanchez in hospital after being stabbed
content: Former NFL quarterback and current Fox Sports broadcaster Mark Sanchez is hospitalized after being stabbed in Indianapolis early Saturday morning.

title: Belichick to stay course as UNC flounders again
content: Bill Belichick shrugged off the need for structural changes after UNC was soundly beaten once again, noting that the program is still "being built."

title: Brewers' Chourio leaves G1 injured after 3 hits
content: After becoming the first player to have three hits in the first two innings of a postseason game, Milwaukee Brewers outfielder Jackson Chourio left his club's 9-3 win over the Chicago Cubs with an injury during Saturday's NL Division Series opener.

title: Cincinnati delivers 1st loss to No. 14 Iowa State
content: Cincinnati made the most of a 17-point first quarter en route to a thrilling 38-30 victory over No. 14 Iowa State on Saturday, the Bearcats' first win over a ranked opponent at Nippert Stadium since defeating No. 16 Houston 35-20 on Dec. 4, 2021.

title: Jets cut returner Williams after gaffes in MNF loss
content: Isaiah Williams, who lost a fumble on the second-half kickoff in Monday night's 27-21 loss to the Dolphins, was waived by the Jets on Saturday.

title: Navy rides record day from WR Heidenreich to win
content: Navy wide receiver Eli Heidenreich set a pair of team records with 243 receiving yards and three touchdowns in Saturday's win over Air Force.

title: Mariners leave All-Star Woo off ALDS roster
content: The Mariners left All-Star starter Bryan Woo off their AL Division Series roster, a clear indication that he has not fully recovered from a pectoral injury.

title: Former coach Fisher makes tearful return to FSU
content: Jimbo Fisher was brought to tears while returning to Florida State's campus for the first time since resigning to take the Texas A&M coaching job in 2017.

title: 🌭 Phillies offer 'fun size' 9-9-9 Challenge box
content: The Phillies' Challenge box will offer "fun size" hot dogs and "petite" beers, as well as a built-in scoreboard for fans to track their progress.

title: Four 'Wide Rights' lead the unique history of key kicking miscues in Miami-Florida State
content: Since 1990, no fewer than seven ranked showdowns between the Seminoles and Hurricanes have been decided in large part by unconverted field goals.

title: Cramming for NFL Week 5: Five fantasy sleepers, three predictions, three trends and an intriguing bet
content: Will the Giants' receivers step up? More success coming for Woody Marks? A lot of points expected in Raiders-Colts? Here's last-minute intel for Week 5.

title: Dramatic Chelsea win makes a statement and raises a question: Are Liverpool in crisis?
content: While Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca got a big statement win, worries for Liverpool and Mohamed Salah deepen.

title: How did the Browns decide on starting QB No. 41? Inside their 'intentional' methods
content: The quarterbacks room has been developed to give Dillon Gabriel (named Sunday's starter) and Shedeur Sanders space to grow.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Marner in Vegas, Sullivan in New York and Crosby ... on the move? Guide to the NHL season
content: Miss anything the past few months? Miss everything? Get caught up here before opening night on Tuesday.

title: College football recruiting intel: Could we see big flips? Which classes could rise?
content: Are Florida recruits wavering? Could we see some five-star flips? We look at where the classes and top prospects stand.

title: Russell takes surprise Singapore pole over Verstappen
content: George Russell took a surprise pole position for Mercedes at the Singapore Grand Prix ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen in second place and championship leader Oscar Piastri in third.

title: Paolo Banchero, Trae Young: Breaking down 10 names that could define NBA season
content: ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks down players and personnel that will play major roles on the court and beyond.

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 5: Jaxson Dart, Brenton Strange among top options
content: With many quality fantasy starters on byes this week, we have options at each position to fill in for you.

title: 'Two Hall of Fame quarterbacks just battling it out': A mini-oral history of 2015 Superdome Duel
content: With the Saints hosting the Giants on Sunday, we asked those who were there to recall the teams' epic 52-49 game.

title: Kelly scores stunner but Arsenal lose at Man City. Are Gunners' title hopes over already?
content: Arsenal's Chloe Kelly scored against former club Manchester City, but the Gunners fell to a defeat that puts a big early dent in their WSL title hopes.

title: Projecting 2026 No. 9 Jacy Abii's fit at Notre Dame, more five-star commits
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including the third Fighting Irish recruit for 2026-27.

title: Christian Horner's F1 return: Where next after Red Bull exit?
content: With Christian Horner now free to return to Formula 1 in 2026, speculation about his next landing spot is rife - ESPN ranks the likelihood of his options.

title: 📈 Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: 🩺 Tyreek Hill injury timeline, impact on Fins
content: What is the Dolphins WR's outlook for a dislocated knee, the on-field impact of his absence and his future in Miami.

title: 👊 MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: 🏆 Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: ⛳ Ryder envelope rule must change, Bradley says
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: 🗣️ Players support Collier in ripping WNBA
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: 💰 Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: 🏈 Colts CB Howard abruptly retires
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs set to bid for Man Utd's Bruno in January
content: Saudi Pro League could come back in for Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Cough syrup tragedy: MP bans Coldrif as kids' death toll rises to 11
content: Eleven children died in MP's Chhindwara from renal failure after consuming cough syrup. A lab report confirmed Coldrif syrup contained 48.6% diethylene glycol, a poisonous industrial chemical. This prompted MP to ban the medicine and other products from its manufacturer, Sresan Pharmaceuticals, while multi-state checks on drug units are now underway.

title: Poisoning charges emerge in Zubeen Garg death case
content: The probe into Zubeen Garg’s death has dramatically escalated with fresh poisoning allegations now central to the inquiry. The SIT arrested manager Siddharth Sharma, citing a co-accused's claim that Zubeen was poisoned in Singapore by Sharma and Shyamkanu. A judicial commission has also launched its independent probe, with the CM awaiting the viscera report for truth.

title: Nirav Modi case: India may give 'no arrest' pledge to get him extradited
content: Indian agencies will assure a UK court that no new cases will be filed against fugitive Nirav Modi if he is extradited, and he won't face fresh arrests or interrogations beyond existing charges. This submission aims to counter Modi's appeal to reopen his extradition trial, which the UK High Court previously approved. The hearing is set for November 23.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: Trump's Gaza plan: Israel prepares for '1st stage'; what is the 20-point proposal?
content: Hamas partially accepted President Trump's peace plan for Gaza, expressing readiness for immediate talks on hostage release and ending the conflict. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu also prepared to implement the plan's first stage. The proposal outlines a deradicalized Gaza, technocratic governance, and a pathway to Palestinian self-determination, with Trump overseeing redevelopment efforts.

title: 'Forwarding pro-Pak message not sedition': Allahabad high court grants bail to man
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a Meerut man, Sajid Chaudhary, accused of sharing a "Pakistan zindabad" post. The court observed that merely supporting another country does not constitute endangering India's sovereignty under BNS section 152, though it might fall under promoting enmity. Sajid was charged under BNS section 152 and had been incarcerated since May.

title: ‘English did not rule India’: Elon Musk replies to viral post; sparks outrage
content: Elon Musk's 'thinking face' emoji reaction to a controversial X post, which argued that British rule in India wasn't colonization if Indians in England become English, sparked widespread outrage. Users heavily criticized Musk and the post's flawed logic, emphasizing the stark difference between legal immigration and violent colonial subjugation, and reminding him of historical atrocities.

title: Amid efforts to repair ties, PM Modi again hails Trump's Gaza move
content: PM Modi welcomed President Trump's leadership on the Gaza peace plan after Hamas agreed to release hostages, calling it "decisive progress." This endorsement is crucial for mending strained India-US ties, which saw recent positive developments like resumed trade talks. Future meetings between the leaders remain uncertain, contingent on trade progress and Trump's participation in upcoming summits.

title: Bareilly violence: Marriage hall of Raza aide razed, house sealed
content: A Samajwadi Party delegation, including MPs, was repeatedly stopped from reaching Bareilly to meet families affected by recent communal clashes. This occurred as authorities demolished a marriage hall linked to an aide of an arrested leader, citing violations.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
content: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: NFL trade rumours: Miami Dolphins may trade Tyreek Hill after devastating injury
content: Miami Dolphins star Tyreek Hill, recovering from a severe knee injury and embroiled in a legal scandal, might be released before next season. Reports indicate the Dolphins plan to cut him before his 2026 salary guarantees, despite his manager stating he'll be ready for Week 1. The Pittsburgh Steelers reportedly backed off interest due to his domestic violence allegations.

title: India-UK relations: PM Modi to meet Keir Starmer in Mumbai on October 9
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will make his first official visit to India on October 8-9, heading to Mumbai. He and PM Narendra Modi will address the Global Fintech Fest and hold bilateral talks. Their agenda includes reviewing the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, Vision 2035, and the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement.

title: Gisele Bündchen finds healing in nature and family as ex-husband Tom Brady watches afar
content: Gisele Bündchen, 45, embraces a new chapter, sharing glimpses of her seven-month-old baby boy, life with Joaquim Valente, and her deep connection to nature. Her recent Instagram post highlighted a tender photo of her newborn and a message of mindfulness, showing her grounded lifestyle in Brazil focused on family and healing.

title: Giants star Malik Nabers slams 'broken justice system' LSU teammate's tragic death
content: Giants rookie Malik Nabers expressed anguish over former LSU teammate Kyren Lacy's tragic death by suicide, which occurred a day before a grand jury hearing. Lacy faced negligent homicide charges, but his attorney claimed new evidence showed innocence. Nabers criticized the justice system and media for destroying reputations before facts are known.

title: Stephen A. Smith on Shedeur Sanders’ 'silence' amid Browns QB drama
content: Shedeur Sanders made headlines in Cleveland on October 1, 2025. He remained silent during a press conference. Stephen A. Smith defended his actions, calling judgment unfair. Cam Newton discussed Sanders' brand value for the Browns. Both analysts agreed his true test would come only when he steps onto the field.

title: Novak Djokovic net worth: Know about his career, Shanghai Masters update & more
content: Novak Djokovic continues his dominance in 2025, winning matches and accumulating over $190 million in career prize money. His estimated net worth of $240-250 million is bolstered by major endorsements and new business ventures like Joe & The Juice. Still competing at the highest level, he recently returned to the Shanghai Open and secured his 100th career title.

title: J&K: National Conference to contest all 4 RS seats; ally Congress wants one
content: Jammu and Kashmir's ruling National Conference will contest all four Rajya Sabha seats, refusing to concede any to ally Congress, which seeks at least one. BJP also announced contesting all seats, dismissed by NC. Polling is on October 24 for the long-vacant seats. The NC-Congress alliance holds 53 MLAs in the 88-member assembly, setting the stage for a keen contest.

title: Ladakh: Govt calls Ladakhis peace-loving patriots; dialogue process to start soon
content: The Ladakh government affirmed the Centre's commitment to dialogue with Ladakhi groups, despite recent talks being called off after a September 24 incident involving security forces and protesters. Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal assured protection of land, resources, and cultural identity, while refuting claims of demographic change or commercial exploitation, emphasizing a carbon-neutral development path.

title: Mark Sanchez stabbing: Former New York Jets star brutally attacked in Indianapolis
content: Ex-NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez was stabbed in downtown Indianapolis early Saturday morning, October 4, 2025. Initially in critical condition, FOX Sports confirmed he is now stable and recovering in the hospital. One suspect has been taken into custody following the violent altercation, which occurred while Sanchez was in town for a broadcasting assignment.

title: J&K: Pakistani drone spotted near border village; combing operation on
content: Security forces launched a massive search operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district after a suspected Pakistani drone was spotted hovering over a border village on Friday night. This incident follows two other recent drone sightings in the Ramgarh sector and over a military garrison in early September, raising concerns about potential airdrops.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Udhampur airport launch finalised
content: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh announced the finalisation of Udhampur airport's operationalisation, with Kishtwar airport also joining the UDAN scheme. This initiative will significantly reduce airfares, particularly for Delhi-Udhampur flights, making travel more affordable. Operations will commence with ATR 72-seater aircraft, capping ticket prices at nearly half the prevailing market rates.

title: Pak kowtows to US: After rare earth & crypto, Munir offers port to Trump
content: Advisers to Pakistan’s military chief proposed a $1.2 billion port at Pasni to US officials, aiming to transport critical minerals and offer Washington a strategic presence. This initiative, part of a broader effort to strengthen ties with the Trump administration, seeks to diversify Pakistan's options and counterbalance China's influence.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Vaishno Devi closed for three days from today after rain forecast
content: Vaishno Devi temple in J&K will close for three days from October 5-7 due to heavy rain forecasts, announced the Shrine Board. This follows a 22-day shutdown in August after a landslide killed 34. The pilgrimage had resumed on September 17, with over 1.70 lakh devotees visiting since then.

title: Indian student shot dead in US: Killed by 'miscreants'; was working at gas station
content: A 26-year-old Hyderabad student, Chandrashekar Pole, was tragically shot dead by an unidentified gunman at a Dallas gas station where he worked part-time. Pole had moved to the US in 2023 for higher studies, completing his master's degree six months ago. BRS MLA T Harish Rao met the bereaved family and demanded that the Telangana government make arrangements to bring Pole’s mortal remains back to his hometown.

title: 'Biggest honour': Gill's first reaction on becoming ODI captain; shares World Cup vision
content: Indian selectors have removed Rohit Sharma from ODI captaincy, appointing young opener Shubman Gill as the new leader with the 2027 World Cup firmly in sight. This strategic move aims to groom Gill as India’s all-format captain, while Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retain their places in the squad for the upcoming Australia series.

title: 'Playing at home without Ashwin feels different': Jadeja lauds India's spin options
content: Ravindra Jadeja starred in India's crushing Test victory over West Indies, scoring 104 not out and taking 4/54. He expressed missing retired spin partner Ravichandran Ashwin, while also discussing the team's emerging spin talent and his own batting resurgence due to mindset and fitness adjustments.

title: Hyderabad student killed in US: 800+ Indian student deaths since 2018; US leads the list
content: A Hyderabad student, Chandrashekar Pole, was fatally shot in Dallas while working part-time, highlighting ongoing safety concerns for Indian students abroad. Data from the Ministry of External Affairs, reported by Dataful, shows 842 Indian student deaths overseas between 2018 and 2024, with the US leading at 141 deaths. Most fatalities were due to medical causes, suicides, and accidents. The data calls for urgent action from policymakers, universities, and families to improve student safety and support.

title: ‘Swadeshi Campaign’: Govt push for Indian textiles; demand 'to hit' $250 bn by 2030
content: The Ministry of Textiles has launched the 'Swadeshi Campaign' to significantly boost domestic demand for Indian handloom, handicrafts, and textile products. This initiative targets urban youth and Gen Z, aiming to reposition Indian textiles as symbols of pride and heritage.

title: UK PM to visit India: Focus on 'Vision 2035'; Starmer's 1st official trip
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will visit India on October 8-9, 2025, at PM Modi's invitation for his first official trip. The leaders will review the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership under 'Vision 2035' and attend Mumbai's Global Fintech Fest.

title: China's K visa faces online backlash: Locals vent on Weibo; here's why
content: China's new K visa, aimed at attracting young international STEM graduates without a prior job offer, is drawing significant criticism. Netizens are concerned about its timing amidst high domestic unemployment and a large influx of new graduates, fearing it favors foreign talent and lacks robust vetting processes. The visa's launch has been delayed.

title: Kyren Lacy controversy: Lawyer claims ex-LSU WR wrongly blamed in fatal crash
content: Former LSU player Kyren Lacy's suicide, ahead of negligent homicide charges, sparks controversy. His attorney, Matt Ory, challenges the Louisiana State Police investigation into a fatal accident. New surveillance footage reportedly shows Lacy was back in his lane before impact, contradicting official accounts. Ory cites inconsistencies and missing witness testimony, suggesting evidence doesn't support Lacy's culpability, deepening the tragedy.

title: Female admissions at IITs stuck at 20%: Policy met its quota; deeper barriers remain
content: Despite policy interventions like the Supernumerary Seats Scheme, female enrolment in IIT BTech programmes remains stagnant at around 20% as of 2025. While the number of women admitted has risen in absolute terms, the proportional share has seen minimal growth since 2020. Social, cultural, and institutional barriers—including safety concerns, high coaching costs, and confidence gaps—continue to limit access. Data over five years highlights the need for deeper reforms beyond reserved seats.

title: 'You taught India what it takes to win': Dinesh Karthik's heartfelt tribute to Rohit Sharma
content: Dinesh Karthik lauded Rohit Sharma's impactful ODI captaincy, praising his tactical brilliance and aggressive leadership that led India to two ICC trophies in 2024 and a strong winning record. However, selectors removed Rohit, appointing Shubman Gill as the new ODI captain for the Australia tour, with an eye on the 2027 World Cup.

title: Pak buckles in PoK: Sharif govt, protesters sign pact - what's in the deal?
content: Protests in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir concluded after an agreement. The Pakistan government and protestors signed a 25-point charter. This followed days of violence and unrest in the region. The deal includes compensation for victims and significant developmental measures. Key provisions cover education, health, and electricity improvements. Administrative reforms and infrastructure projects are also part of the agreement.

title: 'Trying to steal Jan Nayak title': PM slams Rahul; blames RJD for Bihar's woes
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated significant education and skilling projects in Bihar, including the Jan Nayak Karpoori Thakur Skill University. He subtly criticized Rahul Gandhi over the 'Jan Nayak' title and launched PM-SETU worth Rs 60,000 crore, alongside other youth-centric initiatives, while blaming previous RJD rule for educational woes.

title: New ODI captain: 'Virat & Rohit unlikely for 2027 WC' - Ex-England cricketer backs Gill
content: Shubman Gill has been appointed India's new ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma, with Shreyas Iyer named his deputy for the upcoming Australia tour. This significant leadership change, praised by former selector Madan Lal, signals a strategic shift towards building a young core for the 2027 World Cup, even as experienced players like Rohit and Virat Kohli remain in the squad.

title: India's ODI squad: Gill named captain; end of the road for Shami and Jadeja?
content: Shubman Gill has been appointed India's new ODI captain for the upcoming series against Australia, with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli included in the squad. However, Ravindra Jadeja and Mohammed Shami appear to be excluded, signaling a potential end to their ODI careers. The article also details the full ODI and T20I squads and the series schedule.

title: Russia-Pak arms deal: Congress hits out at PM - ‘failure of personalised diplomacy’
content: The Congress party criticized the Modi government's foreign policy after Russia proceeded with supplying advanced jet engines to Pakistan's JF-17 fighter aircraft, despite India's objections. This move highlights the perceived failure of "personalised diplomacy" and India's inability to diplomatically isolate Pakistan, even as Moscow remains a key defence partner for New Delhi.

title: World Teachers’ Day 2025: 100+ wishes, quotes, images and status to share
content: World Teachers' Day on October 5, 2025, celebrates educators' vital role in shaping lives, especially amidst evolving educational landscapes. This article provides diverse wishes, quotes, and messages—ranging from heartfelt to quirky—for various platforms, encouraging gratitude for teachers' dedication and profound impact on students' learning and future.

title: Bulldozers roll in tense Bareilly: House linked to Raza sealed; 'Raja Palace' demolished
content: Bareilly authorities conducted demolition and anti-encroachment drives following recent clashes. Raza Palace, a marriage hall, was demolished for building norm violations, and a house allegedly sheltering Maulana Tauqeer Raza during the violence was sealed. Unauthorized shop and house extensions were also removed in Sailani.

title: After Private Fact-Finding Report On Ladakh, Chief Secretary's Response
content: Ladakh Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal has held "certain sections" responsible for working to sabotage talks after they realised the dialogue process would be able to meet most of the demands of the people of Ladakh.

title: Manipur BJP MLAs In Delhi To Meet Central Leaders, Seek Government Formation
content: BJP MLAs and leaders from Manipur including former chief minister N Biren Singh will meet the party's central leaders to discuss the formation of a popular government in the state.

title: Drums, Bikes And Conservatism: The Making Of Japan's First Woman PM
content: Sanae Takaichi has been elected as the head of Japan's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), placing her in line to become the nation's first woman prime minister.

title: Indian Dental Student, Working Part-Time At US Gas Station, Shot Dead
content: A 27-year-old Indian student has reportedly been shot dead in Dallas, US. Chandrashekar Pole, who was from Hyderabad, was working part-time at a gas station last night when he was killed by an unidentified gunman.

title: 'Move Quickly Or Bets Will Be Off': Trump To Hamas On Gaza Peace Plan
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday warned Palestinian group Hamas to "move quickly" and agree to a peace deal with Israel or risk further devastation in Gaza.

title: "Ready To Start Dialogue Process, Will Protect Land, Jobs": Top Ladakh Official
content: In its first detailed policy statement following violence in Ladakh, the government today announced a slew of confidence-building measures, including protection of land, jobs, and the demographic character of the Ladakh region.

title: High Drama In Kerala As Man Hacks Father, Holds Police At Bay For Hours
content: A family dispute over land papers spiralled into violence and high drama at Kerala's Thrissur on Saturday, when a man hacked his father with a machete and later threatened suicide by barricading himself inside a house for hours.

title: Former Sarpanch's Son Shot Dead In Punjab's Barnala, Probe Underway: Cops
content: The son of an ex-sarpanch, who was in his 40s, was shot dead by an assailant at a village in Barnala district on Saturday, police said.

title: Karnataka Lokayukta Arrests State Minister's Aide In Bribery Case
content: The Karnataka Lokayukta has arrested an aide of state Energy Minister KJ George for allegedly demanding a bribe of Rs 1 lakh to grant a no-objection certificate (NOC) for an electricity connection for a builder.

title: 2 Dead, 5 Injured In Blast At Coaching Centre In UP's Farrukhabad: Cops
content: Atleast two people were killed, and five others were injured in a blast at a coaching centre in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad on Saturday.

title: Poisoning Angle Will Be Clear By Oct 10: Himanta Sarma On Zubeen Garg Death
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that the state government will receive the report of singer Zubeen Garg's viscera sample from New Delhi's Central Forensic Science Laboratory (CFSL) on October 10.

title: BJP Reaches Out To Vijay Days After Stampede With An Advice: Sources
content: The BJP has reached out to South superstar Vijay's party days after the Karur stampede, said sources, hinting that the saffron party is working to utilise the actor's massive fan base to improve its chances in the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections.

title: PM Modi, Keir Starmer To Hold Wide-Ranging Talks In Mumbai On Oct 9
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will undertake a two-day visit to India next week in his first trip to the country since assuming charge of the top office in July last year.

title: Watch: Old Video Of Japan's Next PM Belting Out Rock Anthem On TV Is Viral
content: As Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) rallies behind Sanae Takaichi to become the country's next prime minister, a video has resurfaced showing the conservative leader singing X Japan's classic rock anthem "Rusty Nail".

title: Man Drowns 4-Month-Old Son In Drum, Then Dies By Suicide: Cops
content: A four-month-old boy whose body was found in a half-filled blue drum had been drowned by his father, who also killed himself, the Maharashtra police said Saturday.

title: Damaged Eardrum, Bloody Nose: Maharashtra Doctor Thrashed By Patient's Family
content: A doctor was left with a ruptured eardrum and a bloody nose following an attack by the relatives of a patient at a hospital in Maharashtra's Jalgaon.

title: Kerala Latest State To Ban 'Coldrif' Cough Syrup After Unexplained Deaths
content: Kerala has become the latest state to suspend the sale and distribution of the cough syrup Coldrif, after reports from Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan linked the medicine to the deaths of at least 11 children over the past month.

title: Video: At Virtual Meet With PM Modi, Nitish Kumar's Unusual Gesture
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar virtually attended a skill convocation ceremony for ITI toppers from across the country on Saturday, where Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented certificates to the students under the Kaushal Deekshant Samaroh 2025.

title: Hamas Responds To Donald Trump's Gaza Peace Plan: Read The Full Text
content: Hamas on Friday responded to the 20-point Gaza peace plan after US President Donald Trump gave them until Sunday to accept or face grave consequences.

title: How Close Is The Gaza War To Ending After Trump's Proposed Peace Plan
content: President Donald Trump has urged Israel to halt its bombing of Gaza after Hamas agreed to release hostages and accepted some key parts of a US peace plan - a shift that could mean a two-year-old war is finally coming to a close.

title: Explosion at coaching centre in UP kills two and injures five others
content: With more than two decades of experience, writes extensively on crime stories. His professional portfolio extends to environmental journalism, wildlife protection initiatives and political developments. His thorough reporting on diverse social issues has contributed significantly to positive changes. title: Rollins creates more animosity with Cody, Orton
content: seth Rollins continues to question himself and be fueled by his desire for revenge and validation . the vision def. cody Rhodes and Randy Orton defeated Rhodes . a stomp on Orton was an interesting end because it adds another layer of animosity .

title: 13 more games, 13 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: quarterbacks QBs Baker Mayfield and Sam Darnold will face off again in the Bucs-Seahawks matchup . sports reporters take you inside the locker room with the best thing they heard this week . fantasy analyst Eric Moody shares fantasy football intel . we also have football power index (FPI) matchup quality ratings .

title: Zubeen Garg death: Assam CM to provide details of case; sets big condition
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: H-1B visa row: US outfits sue to halt Trump's $100K entry fee; Indian among plaintiffs
content: the diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries . she also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities . read more The rainbow of the wild: 10 colourful and rare insects across the globe .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: Top regression candidates for 2025-26: Geekie, Scheifele, more
content: last season, there were plenty of opportunities for regression, given what occurred during the 2023-24 season . candidates for regression include those most likely to see a 10+% drop in production, whether it's goals or points, based on their situations .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cook leads RBs in season scoring, Daniels is top-five QB
content: field Yates has Deebo Samuel as a top-20 fantasy wide receiver in week 5 against the Chargers . all mentions of fantasy points are for PPR formats, unless otherwise noted . RB James Cook rushed for 16 touchdowns last season, but seven running backs scored more .

title: Smart changes ease Amorim pressure -- but for how long?
content: manchester united beat sunderland 2-0 in the premier league on saturday . a penalty overturned by VAR was thrown out of the penalty area . amorim will feel he was due if he manages a routine win .

title: How the Aces defeated the Mercury
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 89-86 in game 1 of the 2025 WNBA Finals on friday . Dana Evans scored 21 points off the bench, matching the game high of four-time MVP A'ja Wilson and Mercury star Kahleah Copper . jewell Loyd also added 18 points, making them the first pair of teammates with at least 15 points as reserves in a Finals game since 2019 .

title: Leh violence: SC to hear plea against Sonam Wangchuk's detention on Oct 6
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Made India bow': BJP guns for Sonia; says UPA govt was 'puppet in foreign hands'
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Move quickly, or else ...': Trump warns Hamas again; thanks Israel
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: the new york Knicks and Philadelphia 76ers are in Abu Dhabi for a preseason doubleheader beginning Thursday . the trip marks the fourth year of the NBA's games in the united arab Emirates . they were greeted with singing from locals and a quick drink .

title: Follow live: Blue Jays host Yankees in clash of AL East rivals
content:
Today's at BatsFull Player Profile

1st : Grisham grounded out to first.

3rd : Grisham fouled out to third.

title: 'He fought too many times': How the loss to Ankalaev forced Pereira to change
content: former middleweight and then-light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira complained about how he felt ahead of his title defense . pereira surrendered the light heavyweight championship to Magomed Ankalaev by unanimous decision in an eff . he is now one of the world's most dominant champions of all time .

title: CRS, the premier centre for Russian language and literature in India, turns 60
content: Since 1965, alumni of the Centre of Russian Studies have contributed across the domains of diplomacy, academia, defence, Intelligence, and business, with the institute continuing to be in focus in view of the Ukraine crisis

title: What is Nagaland’s job quota issue? | Explained
content: Why is the government relooking its jobs policy? Why are the tribes in the State divided on the policy?

title: Hope speaks a universal language; fight for dignity, democracy same: Rahul in Colombia
content: Artists who use colour as resistance, and students who dream fearlessly inspire me, Rahul Gandhi said

title: Why is a spectre of empty classrooms looming? | Explained
content: What has the Supreme Court ruled on the Teachers’ Eligibility Test? How many teachers are likely to be affected? Why has Tamil Nadu sought a review? What does Article 21A lay down? What is the situation in other States? Are minority institutions part of the verdict?

title: Controversy over remarks on Balasaheb Thackeray’s death, Shiv Sena UBT to file defamation case
content: Sena UBT leader Anil Parab said that the claims made by Ramdas Kadam were a figment of imagination and were made to divert attention from the issues being faced by Maharashtra

title: Allahabad High Court refuse interim protection to Sambhal’s Rayan Buzurg Mosque from demolition
content: The mosque management, in its plea, had claimed that the notices issued were in ‘gross violation’ of the Supreme Court’s directions issued last year which mandated adherence to due process before demolition of religious structures

title: Supreme Court to hear Wangchuk’s wife’s plea on October 6
content: Dr. Gitanjali J. Angmo has asked the apex court to direct the authorities to produce Wangchuk in court

title: How is India responding to crowding disasters? | Explained
content: Why did things get out of hand at actor Vijay’s political rally in Tamil Nadu? What are the crowd control protocols in place? Are these measures statutory? Where have the most enforceable initiatives emerged? Should responsibility of managing crowds be fixed on organisers?

title: Sir Creek | A marshland of contention
content: The 96-km-long estuary that lies between Kutch and Pakistan’s Sindh is of enormous economic importance, and became a flashpoint following Pakistan’s May 8 strikes against India

title: Paddy coverage in Cauvery delta during current Samba season lower than last year
content: The farmers and officials attribute a number of reasons for this fall, with the main one being the late sowing during the short-term Kuruvai season thanks to the unseasonal spell of rain in February-April this year

title: Sonam Wangchuk | Ladakh’s engineer of change
content: The education reformer, roped in by Ladakh’s civil society groups to represent their causes, has been arrested under the National Security Act

title: 2026 Assembly election is about protecting rights of Tamils, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: Stating that his govt., with the people’s support, revived T.N. after 10 years of misrule by the AIADMK, Stalin says only the DMK-led front has the ideological clarity to take on the NDA

title: Technical sanction accorded for Vaduthala-Perandoor bridge
content: Bridge expected to ease city’s growing traffic congestion and provide an easy passage connecting Pachalam and Vaduthala with Perandoor, says Ernakulam MLA; administrative sanction of ₹34.24 crore granted

title: Curve on Chambakkara-Petta stretch turns death trap
content: Two youths lost their lives after their bike rammed a metro pillar near Chambakkara market in the early hours of on Oct. 4, 2025; another accident at the same curve had claimed two lives in January

title: Ernakulam tops in domestic tourist arrivals post-COVID
content: Over 1.19 crore domestic tourists visited the State in the first six months of 2025, marking a 10.50% increase compared to the previous year

title: ₹203 crore for Kempegowda memorials and urban design college: DKS
content: Mr Shivakumar said students graduating from the college will be considered for employment in the Greater Bengaluru Authority(GBA) and municipal bodies.

title: Watch: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra | The Sacred journey resumes
content: Rising high on the Tibetan Plateau, stands Mount Kailash. To millions, it is not just a mountain. It is the axis of the universe, a gateway to the divine

title: Govt. will resolve PHC doctors’ issues, says A.P. Health Minister
content: Their demands will be taken to the notice of the Chief Minister and an appropriate decision taken soon, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: E-auction of Presidential gifts extended till October 15
content: Over 250 gifts available to art lovers and general public; bids for ₹10,000 specimen bank note given to former President Pranab Mukherjee cross ₹17 lakh

title: Health Ministry initiates risk-based inspection of drug manufacturing firms, following contamination in some cough syrup samples tested in Tamil Nadu
content: This move will help finding out the gaps leading to quality failure of drug samples and suggest process improvement, the Ministry said

title: Supreme Court to hear plea challenging Telangana’s enhancement of OBC quota to 42% in local bodies
content: Petition asking if States can breach 50% quota cap in local bodies; the Telangana State Election Commission has notified the panchayat election process in the State to commence from October 9

title: 30 of 70 detained youth released; Ladakh’s land, jobs and livelihood would remain protected: Chief Secretary
content: Dr. Pawan Kotwal says 40 others would be released upon court orders. Meanwhile, Leh Bar Association member advocate Dorjay Gyaltsan says the magisterial inquiry into the September 24 Leh violence is not going in the right direction and detainees are being harassed.

title: Rajya Sabha Chairman calls for meeting of floor leaders
content: A total of 34 leaders have been invited for the meeting, including Leader of the House and Union Minister J.P. Nadda, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju, and his two deputies, Arjun Ram Meghwal and L. Murugan

title: Karnataka reconstitutes organ-specific panels under SOTTO for transparent, expert-driven transplants
content: Karnataka’s Health Department has reconstituted organ-specific advisory committees under the State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation to bring greater transparency, efficiency, and clinical expertise into the organ allocation and transplantation process

title: Vision group formed for providing facilities at ‘C’ category temples in Karnataka
content: The Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Department has constituted a vision group, consisting of seven members, for making recommendations for undertaking development of infrastructure at 34,165 ‘C’ category historical and ancient temples in the State

title: Jal Shakti Minister refutes allegations of unilateral release of water from Damodar Valley Corporation reservoirs
content: For the past several years, the West Bengal government and the DVC have been at loggerheads over release of water from reservoirs into the lower Damodar basin

title: Inquiry ordered after one-and-a-half-year-old dies at Shishu Gruha in Anantapur
content: The baby, handed over to the Women and Child Welfare department due to the mother’s financial difficulties, dies on Dasara

title: Bareilly authorities demolish ‘illegal’ banquet hall owned by man accused in September 26 violence
content: Nafees and his son were arrested on charges of facilitating the assembly of a crowd at Islamia ground on the day of the clashes

title: London court to hear Nirav Modi plea on extradition trial
content: Hearing on November 23 as fugitive diamantaire seeks to reopen extradition trial citing fear of questioning by Indian agencies

title: Veteran Rajasthan Congress leader Rameshwar Dudi passes away
content: He had been in a coma for two years following a stroke; Dudi’s body was cremated in the presence of senior Congress leaders, party workers and his supporters

title: PHC doctors continue their strike for fifth day in Andhra Pradesh
content: They are demanding an increase in the in-service quota and payment of allowances for those working in the tribal areas

title: Zubeen Garg’s wife returns autopsy report, seeks swift justice
content: Although the report by Singapore police ruled out any foul play, people in Assam were not convinced.

title: Kerala government felicitates actor Mohanlal
content: Titled ‘Malayalam Vaanolam, Laal Salam,’ the event drew hundreds of Mohanlal fans to the Central Stadium in Thiruvananthapuram

title: BJP again targets Rahul Gandhi over remarks made in Colombia
content: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia accused Rahul Gandhi of defaming India on foreign soil. Citing an old newspaper report, he alleged that the Congress leader was “partying till 4 a.m. after the 2008 Mumbai terror strikes”.

title: Poisoned tigers, electrocuted elephants, a grim reminder of human-animal conflict in south Karnataka in Wildlife Week
content: As per the Forest Department’s e-Parihara dashboard, between April 2024 and October 2025, there have been 35,580 reported cases of crop raiding and other conflict cases

title: Minister orders inquiry into teachers halting pro-Palestine mime show at school arts fest
content: Mime show was stopped during the school arts festival at Kumbala Government Higher Secondary School on Friday. Two teachers intervened and asked the students to stop the performance before pulling down the stage curtains

title: Govt. recruitment in Karnataka held up over caste certificate issue, despite internal quota order
content: After internal reservation notification, the certificates now need to reflect the category the SC candidate belongs to

title: Officers selected in 2018 Group-I recruitment hopeful of a favourable court verdict
content: The selection of 48 officers, who are currently serving in the State government, is mired in controversy due to allegations of irregularities in the evaluation process and the subsequent legal battles

title: CM reiterates commitment to setting up superspeciality hospital in every district
content: Siddaramaiah says medical colleges have already been set up in 22 districts and the remaining will get them soon

title: Forest dept. project boosts income of Idukki dam’s tribal fishers
content: Earlier, Oorali tribespeople used to fish from the reservoir and sell to middlemen cheaply. Under Malsyaranyakam, launched in 2019, the price is fixed and members of a group sell the fish from a stall. Ninety per cent of the income is deposited in the fishers’ accounts.

title: NOW Partners’ team studies natural farming practices in East Godavari
content: The 30-member professionals’ group representing Brazil, the UAE, and Sri Lanka also interacts with SHG women

title: Siddaramaiah-led Congress govt. slammed for shirking responsibility in helping flood-hit people
content: The former Minister Baburao Chavan says the State govt. should announce a relief package instead of waiting for NDRF grants

title: TDB Vigilance  records the statement of Unnikrishnan Potti
content: He is at the centre of a controversy concerning the alleged “misappropriation and manipulation” of gold-plated copper foil covering the temple’s stone carvings and sculptures

title: Rising awareness helps police register more cases under POCSO Act
content: Kozhikode stands second in the total number of such cases registered in Kerala between January and August 2025 as per figures available with the State Crime Records Bureau

title: A.P. power utilities invite employees’ JAC for meeting on October 8
content: Since the meeting is aimed at sorting out long-pending grievances, the JAC has been advised to drop plan to go on strike from October 15

title: Three arrested in two-year-old murder case in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: Amarnath was murdered after he allegedly blackmailed his friend’s wife over an objectionable video, say police

title: UDF demands Vasavan and Prasanth’s resignation over “misappropriation” of gold-plated panels from Sabarimala
content: BJP leader P.K. Krishnadas says thousands of Ayyappa devotees will lay siege to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s official residence on Tuesday to press their demand for a CBI inquiry

title: Congress slams NDA govt. over new Adani power plant project in Bihar
content: Party leader Kanhaiya Kumar criticises the govt. for ‘handing over’ 1,000 acres of land to the Adani Group at a very low price

title: OBCs to hold a mahamorcha on October 10 in Nagpur against Kunbi certificates’ order
content: The united OBC community protest march on October 10 will go ahead as planned,” Congress Legislature Party (CLP) leader Vijay Wadettiwar said

title: Number of deleted votes in some constituencies of Bihar exceeds victory margins of last Assembly elections, alleges Congress
content: Election Commission of India should act on reports of irregularities impartially and not function as the BJP’s B-team, says Jairam Ramesh

title: Women’s Blind Football World Cup to begin in Kochi on October 5
content: Defending champions Argentina, host India, Brazil, England, Poland, Turkey, Canada, and Japan to participate in the championship

title: U.K. Prime Minister Starmer to visit India from October 8
content: The two leaders will also be attending the 6th edition of the Global Fintech Fest in Mumbai and deliver keynote addresses
